website_summaries.verdict: A premium digital luggage scale that is backed by a 100% satisfaction guarantee and a lifetime warranty.
pros: Compact design makes it simple to bring the scale with you during trips
capacity with precision accuracy of 0.2 lbs
LCD display guarantees you'll have no trouble reading scale measurements
cons: Does not lock luggage weight information on the display
Can be difficult to open the scale's battery compartment

customer_reviews.title: Terrible. Buy this instead.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased after I lost a scale I had for years. It arrived w the battery half drained. I emailed, they nicely replied and said they would ship new batteries, never received. They are not common batteries and quite honestly a hassle to replace. After less than a year it broke. Months later I found my old scale and it still worked. Have never replaced batteries in that one and it’s been over 5 years. Here is the link to it, BUY THIS INSTEAD Travelon Micro Scale, Silver, Small
customer_reviews.author: S. F.

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY ITS A FAKE.
customer_reviews.text: According to reviews it so awesome product but obviously seller has paid lot of money to get 5 star reviews. Well my experience is that this purchase was a waste of money. 1. When weighing normal luggage about 50lbs then its impossible to get the reading fixed. It will bounce 3lbs up and down and you can only guess the correct weight. It can cause some surprises in the airport. With smaller weights there is no problem to get the correct fixed weight. 2. When weighing luggage around 50lbs scale makes noises like its about to crack. ITS a LOW QUALITY and worthless product!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas K.

customer_reviews.title: Bad product.
customer_reviews.text: Just returned this product. Does not work. My new suitcase still has the sticker with big weight number on it, It is 10.5 lb. This scale was showing 5.4 lb. I tried to use it on few other things but inaccuracy continued. Bad product.
customer_reviews.author: sonia gontarczyk

customer_reviews.title: Rocky Start, Amazing Customer Care!
customer_reviews.text: At first, I received a defective product. It was unfortunate especially since I really needed it, but it happens I guess. Then, I was contacted by Tariss customer care when they found out. And they offered to send me a replacement. Unfortunately, I was about to go out of town at the time. I got back about a month later and I contacted them, and not only they kept their word, but I got the replacement within a week. As for the scale itself, it's sleek, feels durable, and very easy to use. No complaints there. All in all, it was a rocky start, but Tariss customer care came through in the end and in a big way.
customer_reviews.author: John Smith

customer_reviews.title: Purchased it in 2016 and only used the handful of ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased it in 2016 and only used the handful of time. I just put a new battery since I couldn't turn it on. When I put the new battery in, it turned on for few seconds, but wouldn't let me change it to "lb" setting then it turned off right after that. I tried another new battery but again, it turned off soon after the new battery was put in. My trip is in just a few days so I'm a little frustrated...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Luggage Scale I've Found
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several other luggage scales, but this is the first one that delivered on what it is supposed to do. Other luggage scales seem to have one problem or another. My last scale had problems once it went over 30 pounds... and, it seems my bags are always over 30 pounds. This scale had no problem with the weight and it's sleek design made it easy to weigh. An extra bonus was it's small size makes it easy to pack into a side compartment just before you leave. That way you have your scale with you when you repack for your return trip. If you need a luggage scale, this is the one I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Pretty bad when you have to buy a new battery ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a trip to Mexico recently. Used it three times at home to weigh our check in bags, the fourth time we used it, it said low battery. Then nothing, battery dead. Pretty bad when you have to buy a new battery after only using the thing 5 times.....I'd find a different scale.
customer_reviews.author: A.M.

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to use with questionable accuracy
customer_reviews.text: Couple of things why it got 2 stars. 1) when i measured a bag 4 times, it gave 4 different readings so I tried with a lighter bag and got 3 readings after 4 tries. So i was not sure which one was accurate specially because the range of readings were 1.5lbs apart. 2) when it locks on a weight, the small weight symbol on the screen stops blinking which is very very very hard to see. If there was an audio indicator like a beep to say it is locked, it will help. I am not aware that this has an audio indicator so if there is one, I will change my rating.
customer_reviews.author: VaidyaFamily

customer_reviews.title: Long Lasting Lithium Battery... Arrived Dead
customer_reviews.text: Arrived but the "long lasting" lithium battery was dead. Not pleased. Also I think it's hilarious that it blames the airport, (they say "airline") scales for being "inaccurate and poorly monitored" when in reality airport scales are calibrated MONTHLY to ensure accuracy. If your bag is over weight, your scale is inaccurate. I work for an airlines, I know what I'm talking about. That being said, every passenger that I've encountered using a hand weight has advised that they have been accurate so far. So let's hope it's true.. You know, since I can't try it out right away due to my dead battery.
customer_reviews.author: Renaisa Law

customer_reviews.title: Hate airport repacking roulette? Me too...
customer_reviews.text: I've pre-travel test driven this scale and am in love. Why you ask? Let's start with the sleek design. It has a smooth brushed metal finish; it provides an easy to set weight pref, i.e., standard to metric or vice versa. It also has an easy to read display panel (which will also display battery level ), and will pack well for traveling. Last, but not least of all, Tarriss has great customer follow-up/feedback. Worth the $ spent. :)
customer_reviews.author: FTE

customer_reviews.title: Nice but doesn't lock - the weight values change continuously in use while holding up 49 or so pounds.
customer_reviews.text: This was very helpful to have on our trip to determine if were within weight limits. The downside is that you must be very still for somewhere on the order of 10-15 seconds for the number to lock. After many uses it may have locked only once for us, varying up to two pounds and point levels, ie. 48.8 to 50.2 and such. Maybe that's because of the sensitivity. It gave us a general idea, but never an exact number so we played it safe and tried to stay away from triggering the number 50. Also it is very easy to accidentally change the unit of measure with one button. Takes a bit to figure out what's happening.
customer_reviews.author: Mikes Shoppin’ Reviews

customer_reviews.title: I love this one !!!!
customer_reviews.text: I researched all of the digital luggage scales available on Amazon, and I picked this one for several reasons. One important reason was how responsive Customer Service responded to customer questions about the product. Also, I like the lifetime warranty. It arrived on time, nicely packaged, in perfect condition, with great (easy to understand) instructions. I immediately tried it out, and LOVED it. I also ordered one for my adult daughter who is a professional speaker and travels all over the US. She also loves hers. Small, compact and sturdy, easy to pack for travel. Just wish it wasn't made in China.
customer_reviews.author: GininNC

customer_reviews.title: I have nothing bad to say about these little scales
customer_reviews.text: I have nothing bad to say about these little scales, I just got back from two weeks in England , as they were putting my bags to be weighed the person said I have got accurate scales I told them it was just a little handheld, I have to come back with another extra suitcase it always end up that way I am going to buy my sister a pair of these hand-held scales she's going to England end of the month I will highly recommend these to anybody I have no problem the same battery is in as I got when I brought in I give this a 10 star if I could well I do Paula e strozier,
customer_reviews.author: paula

customer_reviews.title: Worked great!
customer_reviews.text: We are so happy with the Tarriss Luggage scale. Worked perfectly for weighing our luggage. We had a 15 lb. limit on an Air New Zealand flight, so it was used repeatedly to make sure our carry-on luggage was not over the 15 lbs. Because of the excellent quality of the luggage scale, we also purchased the Search Alert TSA Cable Locks. We are so pleased with the quality of Tarriss's products. They have an excellent lifetime warranty. We appreciate a company that stands behind their products. Thank you Tarriss!!!
customer_reviews.author: AMarie

customer_reviews.title: Poor Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: The #2032 button battery that came with it didn't work. I replaced it with a brand new Energizer brand battery; that one lasted less than a week ... and we haven't even finished packing for our trip yet. I'm about to put in another new Energizer brand battery, and hope for the best. If the next one doesn't last, I probably won't have time to replace it. I would have rated this luggage scale 5 stars for its ease of use if it weren't for the battery problems.
customer_reviews.author: Al T.

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waste Your $
customer_reviews.text: Very awkward and ALSO inaccurate. Almost impossible to get your luggage still enough to get a reading. THEN - - it was almost 10 pounds off. Night before we leave for our trip - - we wasted precious time trying to weigh our luggage. Finally gave up and used our bathroom weight scale which was within a pound of what the airport scale was the next morning.
customer_reviews.author: FIFI1950

customer_reviews.title: Great Scale, Quality build, Measures weight as stated
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to handle, displays weight accurately within 99% for the most part. Tested with calibrated weights. Above 80LB it was harder to handle and keep the weights steady. With 100LB weight the scale felt like it was pushing its design limit, it kind of felt that it would separate in half, but you do not pack 100LB checked bags for most part. It does feel sturdier than most out there. Great item
customer_reviews.author: Dariusz

customer_reviews.title: One caveat about the battery
customer_reviews.text: This is a very great little luggage scale. I'm taking off one star for this reason: When it first arrived I activated the (lithium) battery that came with the product and gave it a try. The next day I began packing and went to use it but the battery was dead. I think perhaps I needed to turn it off, or perhaps it was resting on something that kept it on all night. I had to go to the local CVS and buy a new battery for it. Now when I am done using it I remove the battery and just store the scale and it's battery in a zip lock. Very light weight so easy to pack. Accurate.
customer_reviews.author: L. M. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent travel scale and customer service
customer_reviews.text: I tested this scale on my current trip and it worked great. On the outbound flight, the Tarriss scale said my suitcase weighed 25.4 pounds and the airport scale had my suitcase at 25.5 pounds. I purchase 6 bottles of wine at my destination and the Tarriss scale had my suitcase at 45.8 pounds. The airport scale was 46.0 pounds. The .1 and .2 pounds is within the scale''s margin of error. Works great. ---Update--- On a recent trip, the travel scale cracked when I tried to weigh a suitcase that was 29.8kg. After I returned home, I contacted Tarriss support, explained what happened and they immediately sent out a replacement. Excellent service!!!
customer_reviews.author: Doraemon

customer_reviews.title: Very cool. High quality and a money saver when traveling ...
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: I bought this a year ago for travel. We went to use it again this year and it seems to malfunction. The numbers 8888 show up vs. the luggage weight. Rather than write a negative review, I contacted the company on their website and asked for their advice. (It states 100% guarantee) However, after more than 3 weeks, we never heard back from anyone regarding this situation. So, we had to purchase another scale to make sure our luggage was not over weight. I think this might be a good product, but now I'm not so sure. Oh well! Wow. Very cool. High quality and a money saver when traveling and checking bags. Nice!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Bouc

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 6 months, used for one trip!
customer_reviews.text: Edit: Feb 2019 Since my review, I emailed Tarriss about my situation and they shipped me a new one free of charge. Great customer service. Thank you. This product worked flawlessly when I first got it back in June 2018. I’ve used it once to weigh some luggages that were less than 23KG (50lbs). I’ve tried using it today, (December 2018), although it turns on, it does not give me a reading for the weigh. I would not recommend this product because of its durability. I contacted the company if there’s any warranty on this product. So I’m awaiting for that. Otherwise this gets 0 stars from me.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, easy to use.  But has a drawback sometimes--
customer_reviews.text: The one drawback is that it needs to be held steady to get the exact reading. Most of the time this was fine--but I had a heavy suitcase that I had a hard time holding up--I'd been able to get a reading OK before, but I tried several times and never could get the number to stick! It worked on the other bag, so it wasn't NOT working. I could still see the numbers it was getting, so could guess that my case was under 50lbs, at least. That was the one drawback!
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Buy it! You will not regret it.
customer_reviews.text: I was constantly flying back and forth from my parents house to my college (never traveled light). Constantly had problems with my bags wbeing overweight. Ever since I purchased this, I am able to distribute the weight of my bags properly prior to getting to the airport which has saved me from a lot of hassle. I highly recommend this. I have purchased 3 so far. One for myself, one for my father, and one for a friend who loves to travel. Super lightweight. Accurate within .5 to 1 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight accurate scale for travel
customer_reviews.text: Good tips and feedback from responsive Seller. Prompt delivery. Good design and accurate scale. This is a handy item for travel and I would recommend it over some others that I tried. Those who mention the battery doesn't last....be sure to turn it off before you store it...also, replacement batteries are inexpensive and readily available.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Must-Have for Travel!
customer_reviews.text: This little gadget has a substantial feel, and is very well made, while still remaining lightweight (.2 lbs). It was easy-to-use, and most importantly, accurate! Due to my overpacking,and tendency to buy souvenirs my husband and I were always playing the guessing game with bag weight and have even had to shift items from bag-to-bag at the airport counter. During our most recent vacation, at our hotel, we were able to evenly distribute weight between each of our carry on luggage, and most importantly, our checked bags (which weighed in on the airport scales at 48 & 49 lbs). Highly recommend, especially if you buy any souvenirs while on vacation!
customer_reviews.author: Dexterous Girl

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gifts for coworkers!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had bought one before my trip to Europe in 2019. But this works very well! Bought a few more for coworkers during the holidays because I like to at least give useful items that I know they won't re-gift (🤣) and isn't just another gift card. I work for a hotel....so I thought I'd motivate my coworkers to travel more but not struggle with luggage weight at the airport like I did!
customer_reviews.author: Krizstyle

customer_reviews.title: No More Guessing on Luggage Weight
customer_reviews.text: After so many challenges with luggage weight at the airport, I purchased the Tarriss Jetsetter Digital Luggage Scale and it has always provided very accurate weights allowing me to lighten the load if needed and it also helps me know how close I am to the limit - takes out the guess work! I don't know why I didn't order one a LONG time ago!
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Dependable  and  Convenient!!
customer_reviews.text: Luv it!! I take it with me whenever I fly especially on most of my trips overseas.It keeps accurate readings, and so convenient to carry in a purse/backpack because of its size. The only reason I gave this product a rating of 4 instead of a 5 is because it's hard to weight a 50 lb. luggage using this product. especially if one is petite and unable to lift more than 20 lbs due to health reason.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy

customer_reviews.title: It's so easy, a caveman can use it!
customer_reviews.text: In the past, when we traveled and wanted to make sure our luggage wasn't overweight my husband would get on the scale and weigh himself, then get on the scale again holding the suitcase. What a difficult thing to do to read the scale while holding a suitcase. With more travel on the agenda I decided to get this scale by Tarriss to make trip preparation easier. Not only do I like this scale for home, it's something that can be used for other weighing needs like postage, fish, etc. I know this because the kind people at Tarriss sent me an email and suggested the other uses. Good going Tarriss!
customer_reviews.author: webducky

customer_reviews.title: Lacks two key functions
customer_reviews.text: I have used other scales and this scale lacks two key functions. Firstly, you have to hold the weighted luggage VERY STILL before the scale will register a still reading. Try doing that with a large piece of luggage that’s 60+ pounds because you can’t. There’s also no audible sound to alert you that you have a still reading. Secondly, once the strap goes slack, the clip invariably disengages from the handle. How difficult would it have been to use a strap design that clips into the handle. Poorly designed scale and I regret buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond G Kriete

customer_reviews.title: Hard to hold steady
customer_reviews.text: I really like the scale, but it's a bit difficult to use. The weight seems to be accurate once it is steady enough to lock in. The difficult part is holding a 30 or 40 pound bag up without touching anything while trying to hold it still so the scale can lock onto the correct weight. It was hard for me to hold my large suitcase off the floor and away from my body and try to keep my arms from moving slightly from the strain long enough for the scale to lock on the weight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as accurate as other scales
customer_reviews.text: I thought this product would be very accurate, but in fact have difference of about 1 lb. Which is quite high. Disappointing to go to airport and find out that luggage is one lb overweights.
customer_reviews.author: Hayk

customer_reviews.title: One of the Best Investments I've Made
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this scale for 5 years and it has served me well. Easy to use, once you get the hang of it. Very accurate, usually no more than a pound different than the airport scales (they do vary). I always shoot for 48 pounds, and haven't been over yet. Finally had to change the battery last year (easy to find and change).
customer_reviews.author: Mr. P, DIY

customer_reviews.title: Battery compartment set screw stripped
customer_reviews.text: When I received the scale I wanted to open up the battery compartment to inspect the battery. Using the appropriate size Phillips 'precision' screw driver I attempted to remove the tiny screw but the head was rounded slightly as in stripped and I was concerned that I could not get enough purchase on it in order to break it loose so I could remove it. I finally got it to budge, then I removed it and looked for a replacement screw which I found (torx head) so now it is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: It's Compact and does well
customer_reviews.text: It's not something that I will use often, although I could probably find more uses for it. The real test for me to really sing praise will be next week. I will be traveling all next week and it wil get used many times. If you travel frequently, I think that would be a mainstay of travel necessaries.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Wayne Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Battery missing
customer_reviews.text: scale itself works fine but it arrived without a battery which made it pretty much useless (packaging clearly states battery included). As I needed it as I was due to travel I had to go and buy a battery seperaty. When you add the cost of a new battery it isnt such a good price any more
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Currie

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTE CRAP!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This crappy luggage scale BROKE the FIRST time I tried to weigh a 25 pound suitcase, then I had to pay over $200 for the extra weight at the airport......THANX A LOT!!!! Just returning home from my trip, and now it's too late to return it???? *BEWARE....This company SUCKS and sells CHEAP GARBAGE!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Teri L.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Have not used this for travel yet but weighed some items around the house. Easy to use if you wrap the strap carefully. the instructions are good but are not very intuitive. That’s the only reason I gave it 4 Stars. Otherwise a very modern, sleek product. I’d buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Easy & Handy
customer_reviews.text: So good to know the weight of your luggage Before you get to check-in. And I had occasion to say "oh, my scale said 48 lbs" when the agent said, "Looks like it just made 50"...wonder who would have persevered if she'd said "51 lbs"... but I always have a bit of room elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: L J

customer_reviews.title: Not very accurate
customer_reviews.text: Here is what they claim: "Better Accuracy: The Jetsetter Digital Luggage Scale is highly accurate to within +/- 0.2 lbs, or 0.1 kg. For the most accurate results be sure not to lean the luggage against your legs while weighing as even a slight contact can change the results by plus or minus a pound." However, I find their accuracy claims to not be very accurate. I have used it weigh calibrated weights and find that it consistently weighs light. It measures about 1 lb light with a 10 lb weight, 2 lbs light with a 25 lb weight and 4 lbs light with a 30.5 lb weight. That is not even close to their claims of accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: BobPT

customer_reviews.title: So handy.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t even think it was off by an ounce. Perfect for our trip the the DR where we had to checked a bag (My boyfriend is a major over-packer) and subsequent trip to Florida (I did a lot of shopping and needed to make sure I didn’t end up over-weight on the way back). I love this thing. Easy to use once I figured out how to set it to lbs. nice and small so it fits nicely into a corner of my carry on bag.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Travelers must have
customer_reviews.text: Awesome works excellent. I highly recommend this product for anyone traveling on airlines so that your suitcase meets the weight requirements and there are no surprises or added cost because you went over the weight limit. The product is very compact, lightweight and useful. Weigh your luggage before the trip, throw it in your suitcase and weigh your luggage before you get on that plane .
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Invaluable tool for traveling
customer_reviews.text: Carried this on an international trip with the family. Different flights had different weight restrictions, so this was invaluable to pack our bags and balance the load correctly. We couldn't have had as smooth a checked bag experience without this. Trust me- get this and you won't ever second guess your bag weight again. Its also easy and comfortable to use, just make sure you don't accidently zero the scale when you have weight on it. I did this a couple times. To fix, just zero it again (press the button once) with no weight on it.
customer_reviews.author: Cole

customer_reviews.title: Great travel scale that helps avoid costly overage charges at the airport!!
customer_reviews.text: We are a family of 5 and were traveling for a cruise. This travel scale was great, within a pound of the airport's scales and helped us avoid costly overage charges. We did have a bit of trouble with the scale reverting back to kg instead of pounds but it was very easy to switch it back, just wished it would have stayed put! We traveled with Delta and these days it is the norm to be charged $100.00 for bags over 50 pounds so purchasing this scale at the reasonable price here on Amazon is a must do if you plan to travel!
customer_reviews.author: Finzup5

customer_reviews.title: Pretty close to perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Since I couldn't take my postal scale on our trip, I read the reviews and decided to spend just a little more to get an accurate weight! Right on the money! Definitely a recommendation from me!
customer_reviews.author: C. Kimhan

customer_reviews.title: So happy to write a review
customer_reviews.text: So happy to write a review. I've had this only for about a week or so, but to tell you honestly, I've found very few items that made me so relaxed and happy with a purchase that costs less than a simple meal at a mediocre restaurant! This is by far the most accurate and elegant looking luggage weighing scale. I like that the LED does not have a light to save battery because like they said, there is rarely anyone packing and weighing a luggage in complete darkness.... And it comes with lifetime warranty... LIFETIME!! you don't get that these days any more..... very, Very, VERY highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: ANIR

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and Handy
customer_reviews.text: This little gadget works easily and perfectly which gives you peace of mind when traveling. We use carry-on only and this keeps me in check so that my bag does not become overweight. You can take it along and insure that your bags your are bringing home also meet airport standards for weight.
customer_reviews.author: RoJo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: Could not be more more pleased with the product. Well made and solid construction. As large as it needs to be and no larger. And it's easy to set the unit system it will default to (kilograms, pounds, or stones). Used it this morning to weigh a bag for a Delta flight I will take this Sunday. This scale reported its weight to be 49.8 pounds. That's very close to the 50 pound limit, so I took the bag to my local package shipping store to get a more accurate weight using their scale. Their scale reported the bag's weight to be 49 pounds 13 ounces--which is 49.813 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Blueberry

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this item for one reason to weigh my ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item for one reason to weigh my luggage as accurately as possible. The scale was delivered on time and it seems to be a solid product. When I weigh luggage that are somewhat heavy (over 25 Kg) the scale never stops calculating the weight due to the destabilization of the weight its carrying. But you can look at the screen and memorize the weight that it shows. The weight I recorded on the scale was about 1.5 kg lighter than the airport scale. I would most definitely assume that the airport's scale is more accurate. This was a bit disappointing, as 1.5 kgs are a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Moh

customer_reviews.title: Elegant little investment
customer_reviews.text: Elegant Luggage Scale My grand mother recently come for visit me from another country and in his way back she want to travel with a lot of gift for everybody since I pay for the air ticket, I know how expensive and how awful experience is to pay $$ for over weight luggage or start to get stuff of the bag in order to have under the limit. So I make this little investment in this in my opinion an elegant Scale. I love great design, I really like the design and metal finish if you have some questions please let me know, and if this was helpful please thumps up.
customer_reviews.author: Andres Agredo

customer_reviews.title: Luggage Weight Peace Of Mind.
customer_reviews.text: Good so far. I tested it on a empty suitcase and it gave me an accurate weight total. I purchased this item because I am tired of getting to the airport and holding my breath to see if I have exceeded the weight limit when the airport baggage handler weighs my luggage. I will now have peace of mind knowing that my luggage is fine on the first day of my trip and when I return I can weigh it with all the souvenirs I buy for my family because I feet guilty if I don't bring them something. I will post another review when I used this product after a trip.
customer_reviews.author: DallasNYPSD

customer_reviews.title: It does not lock the weight when it is done
customer_reviews.text: It does not light up, the weight fluctuates and never locks at the correct weight when it is done weighting. I had a Balanzza scale prior to buying this one, which I liked a lot, but gave it away. I just ordered another Balanzza and will be discarding the Tarriss. Wasted money.
customer_reviews.author: M. L. Robbins

customer_reviews.title: Worst Amazon Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This scale doesn't weigh accurately at all. We were charged overweight fees from the moment we stepped into the airport. The scale would tell us that we were under by 6 pounds and then all of a sudden we were overweight by 3. There's no way to tell how much the scale is off either cause it's not a consistent difference. The heavier the baggage got, the more the scale was off.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Product came in specified good condition but...... no batteries..... Ok open up compartment battery inside but battery is dead you have to buy your own also I have to place a new battery inside did not function properly by weight it was tested and did not give up the right amount of weight.
customer_reviews.author: Tropicalone

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item to use before I left for a visit to Spain to see my daughter who is studying abroad and then to leave with her to use when she comes home. I was disappointed to find the battery was already halfway discharged when I went to try it out. I wrote the company and within hours they had contacted me and more than compensated me for the battery. The scale worked perfectly, but the willingness of the company to correct something they they couldn't control (how long the battery sat unused) was above and beyond. I was pleasantly surprised and would highly recommend doing business with them. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Laure K.

customer_reviews.title: Really impressed with this luggage scale.
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with the weight and shape of this scale. The scale is built into the handle, which feels comfortable in my hand. It will be easy to pack this scale away in my luggage, because of its slim shape. I like the way the strap used to attach the scale to the suitcase has an easy to use hook, rather than a buckle. This is the 4th luggage scale that I have purchased over the years and the design improvements of this product, along with its lifetime guarantee might make it the last. I have received NO compensation for this review; I am just really impressed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bannon

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate and has a sleek design
customer_reviews.text: This luggage scale met all my expectations. It’s very accurate and weighs in both pounds and kilograms. I live outside the US and travel to the US with a moderately filled suitcase inside an empty suitcase. I then stock up on clothing and other items that are either much more expensive or difficult to find here. Having an accurate weight scale is essential to avoiding excess weight charges at the airport and the Tarriss scale worked beautifully. Each suitcase came in at just under 50 lbs. I’d recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Rob H

customer_reviews.title: It was pretty spot on with the weight of my luggage though ...
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this scale 5 stars but the one I received didn't work as stated in the email that was sent from Tarriss after purchase. I followed up with them and they promptly sent me another one that did work as expected. Thankfully, I received it just in time to use it before my flight. The scale works as expected. It was pretty spot on with the weight of my luggage though I did make sure to leave a pound or 2 just in case it wasn't.
customer_reviews.author: MP604

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the Tarriss Jetsetter
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. I have only used it once but I know already it will outlive my previous device. It is very easy to use, weighs next to nothing and it is super accurate too. I used to own a Samsonite one that I liked but it broke and I could not get it to work afterwards. It felt a bit flimsy compared to this one. The handle on the Tarriss feels good in your hand and since the display is on top you do not have to bend over to read the display (as it was on my Samsonite one, where it was located on the side of the unit).
customer_reviews.author: KulminhoTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient for weighing postal packages or luggage.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice scale for weighing packages for shipping. The first one I received had trouble measuring, but the seller shipped me out a replacement that works fine (great customer service!). I will be travelling overseas next month, and this will be convenient for ensuring my bags are not overweight going or returning. A helpful tip: Take a long (boot length) shoelace and tie the ends together forming a large loop. Double up the loop and pass one end around the package and through the loop of the other end to form a sling. This works for most packages, and takes up almost no space.
customer_reviews.author: T. Mccleary

customer_reviews.title: A precise, durable and very light digital scale
customer_reviews.text: This is the one that I am looking for a long time. My requirement is a digital scale that is precise, durable, easy to use and very light. This product is definitely meeting my requirements. I am very happy t add it into my my outdoor gears.
customer_reviews.author: chen xi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and very lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality! Compared it to the cheap one that I had, previously, been using and this one by Tarriss gave me a more accurate reading. Will know for sure when I travel again in the near future when the reading will be compared to the airline's readings. But, for now I'm very satisfied and quite confident that it will not let me down like my old one which use to be off by about 5%. It is also very lightweight (only 94 grams) and so will not worry about it adding the risk of excess baggage charges.
customer_reviews.author: Narendra D. Daswani

customer_reviews.title: Accurate scale helps eliminate overage fees!
customer_reviews.text: I just returned from an international trip and due to the amount/weight of souvenirs I was bringing back, I needed to weigh, move items between checked bag and carry-on, and re-weigh my check-in bag a few times to make sure I was under the max limit...and it was perfect when my bag was weighed at the counter. I would have definitely had extra charges for an overweight bag had I not had this scale!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Grogan

customer_reviews.title: One less hassle before your flight
customer_reviews.text: Looks good, works intuitively and seems accurate! I prefer the strap to the hook some other scales use... just makes it a little more user-friendly. Arrives with clear instructions in a neat little box. Customer service is excellent, with proactive email hand-holding. To be honest, I wouldn't expect this much attention from customer service for a product of this simplicity at this price point... I would expect to open the box, read the instructions and get on with it, rather than receive (genuinely) friendly usage tips on email. Their attitude shows pride in their product. And I guess if I someone does have a problem with the device, they would be very prompt to fix the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Reduces unnecessary travel stress and saves time.
customer_reviews.text: Best travel investment I’ve made in a while (certainly a great bang-for-the-buck). I’m notorious for packing heavy and having everything slow down in the process because I’m so concerned about being overweight when checking my bags. One delay always leads to another. The minutes (or more) I lose because of this habit makes travel prep, packing and bag-checking process more stressful than it needs to be. This scale saved me time and reduced my stress because there were no surprises when I checked by bags, and no worries about having to open suitcases at the airport to remove or shift things around.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Felix

customer_reviews.title: Faulty
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a trip to Italy coming up and I opened to check the weight of my suitcase and despite following the directions it will not change units of measure. It stays on kg. Unfortunately it is past the return period.
customer_reviews.author: Robby, Kim and the kids

customer_reviews.title: A scale that ranks 5 on a scale of 1-5
customer_reviews.text: I chose this not for weighing luggage, which I will do anyway when I travel, but for weighing my backpack before a trek so I know what it weighs and can consider trimming as needed. Service was quick. My new toy arrived in perfect condition and I am quite satisfied. We used weights to confirm accuracy and the scale was pretty much spot on. Thank you for your excellent customer care and your useful product.
customer_reviews.author: home improver

customer_reviews.title: Battery issue
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product becos I found good reviews. I'm not completely satisfied, the product did not work the first time, as it was due to battery not fit properly. Moreover, the battery was more than half the battery life (attached image). I had to call Amazon customer service about this. Apart from that, scale works fine now and I hope I would not have any other issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas K

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and handy
customer_reviews.text: Small and easy to carry , it is the perfect companion for travel as I found it so much easier to weigh my luggage this time. The grip itself being the digital scale it is As easy as carrying the bag while weighing it. THe location of the digital screen makes it easy to read while carrying the bag form a normal persons height. Very light weight and portable so i carried it in my handbag for any weight issues at airport. I liked it so much I bough two more to gift to my family
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: Know your luggage weight before traveling
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple and effective way to make sure your luggage is under the legal limit at the airport scale before getting hit with a hefty fine. This hand held device is very easy to set up and use plus it has a lifetime warranty as well. Money well spent for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Breiner

customer_reviews.title: Best companion for traveling
customer_reviews.text: Best companion for traveling. It saved us so much money from knowing what our limits are to avoid over weight luggage fees and embarrassment at checkin. I've seen many people repack all their stuff in front of the check in stand with many people waiting. This little companion is small and pretty accurate. Taken it to Tahiti, Thailand, China, and more!
customer_reviews.author: MTam

customer_reviews.title: Does not freeze the weight information on display
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these based on rating. The scale does not lock the weight information on the display on both the devices. Now I am planning to buy the EatSmart scale that had worked perfectly and happened to gift it to someone.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Digital scale, accurate reading
customer_reviews.text: This digital scale works but I find it hard to use. The product itself is easy to use. The hanging strap you just wrap around the luggage handle, turn it on and lift the luggage. Simple enough, the part I find hard is holding the luggage steady while the digital scale calibrates the weight. You have to hold it for a little while, but it being heavy, I have a hard time keeping the luggage suspended. Other than that the product itself works fine. The reading is accurate as well. You want to weight it a couple of times to make sure you get the same reading each Time.
customer_reviews.author: Tien Truong

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our needs
customer_reviews.text: Tarriss Jetsetter Digital Luggage Scale w/ 110.... first purchased a similiar scale from a retail store that cost $29 but didn't seem to work properly. So we returned it and ordered this one based on the Amazon reviews. Actually, I ordered two, one for each home. It does work as stated. One must ensure that the item is balanced to get consistent and accurate readings. When the suitcase is 50lbs I need to have my husband weigh it as I can't lift that with one hand. This item is perfect because we will need to take it with us when traveling in Europe due to the strict regulations on the cheap airlines.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handy little scale
customer_reviews.text: I'll keep it short and simple. This scale is nice because its feels solid (mix of aluminum and plastic) and has large easy to read numbers. You can easily weigh small things like carry on baggage with one hand. When it comes to larger bags such as the ones you check in, it requires some work because you end up having to lift around 50 pounds in one hand off of the ground without touching anything else (like the side of your leg). Its tough but it can be done. Anyway, that's not the fault of this product, it is the form factor and you should be aware of it.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Snow

customer_reviews.title: First impression of the Tarriss Luggage Scale
customer_reviews.text: I just received my luggage scale so I haven't truly tested it. However, it appears to be of really good quality materials. It is a good and convenient size. Fits my hand well. The read out is very clear and readable. I have "played" with it on several items here at home and it appears to be quite accurate. The test will truly come next week when my luggage weight is tested against the airline luggage weight. So far, I am impressed with this scale.
customer_reviews.author: MyOpinion

customer_reviews.title: Perfect addition for any traveler
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a gift for my mum on Christmas. As she's an avid traveler. She use to weigh her baggage by standing in a scale and weighing herself while holding the baggage lol pretty insufficient as she needs a second person to view the weight. Now with this, she can do it all herself.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Don't leave home without it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a PERFECT travel tool which will pay for itself over and over. We bought this as a replacement for our old scale which broke.... We can't picture traveling without one of these little gems, and this stainless steal one is super nice. Lightweight and small, it will easily tuck into the carry-on to be as useful for the return trip as it is for the outbound. Can not even count how many times my bag has been 49 pounds plus additional ounces and I have been able to check it with complete confidence of no overweight fees. None of that embarrassing shuffling of luggage I have seen others doing when their bag is overweight. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Randi Kozera

customer_reviews.title: Sleek minimal design
customer_reviews.text: I had a luggage scale in the past (purchased via Amazon) however we gave that to my in-laws since they traveling frequently. So I purchased this one which is a decent model. Its very compact, easy to hold and lift heavy weight with one hand. The belt loop is a simple hook which makes it very quick and easy to weight multiple bags very quickly. I traveled with this for the first time this past weekend and I just kept it in my carry-on bag-pack. Its so small that you won't even know its there. Build quality also feels pretty solid.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: faulty product never buy it again!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awful experience! I got the product I tried the supplied batter did not work. I tested the battery it checked out good. But I went to buy the same battery type 2032 from a more expensive brand it still did not work but worked on another product requires the same batter. Then I got to knew this is a faulty product! Never buy it ever! Keep away from this product!
customer_reviews.author: Laszlo Szikszai

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: This hand scale do the job accurately! I do extensive international travel with my family, regularly checking 12 bags on each trip... and each bag will have 49.5 lbs every time. Never had issues with excess weight charges or having to open bags at the counter, like I saw many people do.
customer_reviews.author: Buck Marley

customer_reviews.title: Very Handy Travel Companion
customer_reviews.text: I have been delaying writing the review until I fully tested this. It works great! It is small and very portable. I have used it in multiple countries now to ensure we don't hit weight limits. Flipping between pounds and kilograms was mostly just for fun until we were in India. Internal flights in India have somewhat random weight limits for packed luggage and carry on luggage (all measured in kg) so being able to see if this bag was under 12 kg and another was under 15kg was really useful.
customer_reviews.author: Lstrassn

customer_reviews.title: You know it's a good product when you see one
customer_reviews.text: You know it's a good product when you see one. I bought this scale and I'm really happy about it. The top half was metal and the bottom was injection molded plastic and they come together nicely. The parting line was tight, I don't feel there is anything slicing my hand when I got a hold onto the handle, which means Tassiss has invested good fortune on their mold, that's a big plus for me because when I buy a plastic product I'm expecting to sand the parting line off with fine sandpaper. Not with this product. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: SHAWN

customer_reviews.title: Weigh luggage before flights
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so that I can weigh the bag before going to airport after having to re-shuffle items in 2 bags at the ticket counter to save heavy bag charges, that are too high. Works well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Joe - Everett, WA

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT QUALITY - EXCELLENT CHOICE!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my husband who works overseas, and travels a lot. He is very impressed with it. It is light and compact, and easily slips into his carry-on bag. It gives very quick readings, so no need to hold the bag for a certain time before getting the reading. It is of the highest quality, and very well made. It was an excellent choice. So glad I bought this one. Well, now I've just made a second purchase - I've bought one of my own!! I'm very impressed with it too. It is so much lighter and less bulky than the one I had. It's faster with the reading too. I couldn't be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A necessary item when traveling - a good accurate scale
customer_reviews.text: I tested this scale against a known standard and the accuracy was spot-on the money. Equally Important is repeatability, and the scale measured the same every time. Spending a few bucks here is a whole lot better than the $100 the airlines charge for overweight bags. Tarriss also pointed out that although this scale is accurate, many of the airline scales do not hold to the same accuracy, or are improperly maintained. Therefore it's always a good idea to keep your checked baggage a couple of pounds below the limit.
customer_reviews.author: W. J. Magee

customer_reviews.title: Just facts... testing.
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this scale for my trip, in order to trust a scale you need to test it first.. the accuracy is very good, the only tricky part is to not let the weight swing.. that is going to add .2 to .4 lb more...
customer_reviews.author: marte

customer_reviews.title: Accurately weighs suitcases
customer_reviews.text: It did exactly what it was suppose to. It was accurate in the weight calculation. I didn't have any surprises when I went to airport which was great. I do wish it was a little smaller but its lightweight so I can slip it easily into my carryon or checked bag.
customer_reviews.author: T. Patel

customer_reviews.title: Worth its weight
customer_reviews.text: This has saved my life a few times over the last year or so, as I've taken multiple international flights and had to carefully weigh my luggage beforehand. It's convenient, easy to use, and worth the very slight extra weight for the peace of mind it gives me when I lug my bags to the airport.
customer_reviews.author: Aubrey M

customer_reviews.title: Look at the pictures to see how to use!
customer_reviews.text: I love the emails and communication from the seller. I've gotten two emails, each with pretty useful tips like how to conserve battery and set the units. The scale itself is great. The only issue I had was figuring out how to hook things. I had forgotten to look at the pictures online, so I started getting creative but things kept falling. I suddenly had the light bulb moment of hooking it to the scale itself. Sure enough, that's what all the pictures show. -_-; Sometimes I tend to over complicate things. Ha. This is a great scale! :D
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Accuracy is off by one pound.
customer_reviews.text: This scale is off by one pound. I ordered it and used it for a trip, and after getting to the airport it was exactly one pound off. I had to transfer items from one bag to another oh, and had this scale handy at the same time. Either the Airlines baggage scale was off buy a pound or this scale was off by a pound.
customer_reviews.author: ZX

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and compact
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and matched the weight determined by the airline. The readout varies a bit with the wobbling that naturally occurs when I attempt to lift a 50 lb suitcase, but that can be minimized by using two hands.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to Get Weight Locked In, No Backlight
customer_reviews.text: Overall, very good, but two points where improvements can be made: No back lighting, and -- more important -- it seems to be too sensitive. It's supposed to lock in the weight once settled, but it continues to adjust with the slightest movement of the item you are weighing and is almost impossible to keep the item steady. Not easy with 40-pound luggage dangling from the scale in your hand.
customer_reviews.author: Bart S.

customer_reviews.title: Light, small and easy to usee.
customer_reviews.text: A buddy had one of these prior to a recent trip and I used his before the return trip. It worked great and I ordered one when I got home. Unlike the fishing type scales I've used, this one has a strap rather than a simple hook. The strap is wrapped around a luggage handle or strap making it easy to secure the scale to the bag. Both of these initially came up in KG but it's a simple task to change it to pounds and it will remember the set scale when you use it again. The scale is light and compact making it easy to carry along to weight bags for the return trip
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Terry

customer_reviews.title: Bad product, my first bad experience buying online
customer_reviews.text: I just opened the box and it never turn on, no screen message to indicate low battery problem. Nothing really displaying. Bad Product. First time I have an issue buying online, dissapointing.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: It's a good weigh scale to give you an idea of the ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a good weigh scale to give you an idea of the weight, but itn't very accurate. We used this to fly emirates, and the weight had an error of 8-10%. For a 50lb pag, when we weighed it on airlines scale, it came around 46 ... Not so much of an issue, but when you carry 4 such bags, that 25lb. You could get away from carrying a cabin. I understand there are lot of variables, since when you pick the bag, it's not always the same pattern you pick it in, the force used on the sruface area etc but i thought the error deviation would at least be less.
customer_reviews.author: S. Sethiya

customer_reviews.title: Good product but I had calibration issues.
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews, I was excited to order one for myself. I ordered this product and it worked fine when I was measuring weights of around 20-25 pounds. However, there were some calibration issues at the weight range of 45-55 lbs, which is the limit on economic flights. The scale would not get stable at one single value. Nevertheless, it still gave me an idea about the weight of my bags. Saying that I'm sure it was a one-off case, as reading the reviews, I can say that not many people have had any issue regarding this. For the looks, compactness, and usefulness, I give it a 2-star rating. If there weren't any calibration issues, it deserved 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Gaurav

customer_reviews.title: Weighs luggage in stones or in Gaelic "stane"!
customer_reviews.text: Funny. This scale comes with three weight settings. You get lb, kg, and st. What on earth is 'st'? I wrote the company and they said "stones". Being of Scottish decent I went "wow" - Scottish stone. A stone weighs 14 pounds. How about 'cabers'? The caber usually weights about 79 kg or 175 lbs. They could put a little 'ca' in there. "Mee bagggagg ways inn at 0.285 cabers! New, den't yer bee tossing mee luggagge around like a caber!"
customer_reviews.author: WorldTraveler

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Accurate, compact, easy to use and reasonably priced. Opened the box and turned it on. Wrap the strap and pick up the item. Boom, done. I purchased it for travel but I also happen to have an insatiable curiosity to know what things weigh (especially at the gym). This compact unit is easy to carry in a bag and is ready to go. Upon receipt I weighed two kettle bells (10# each) separately and then together. IF the kettle bell manufacturer is to be trusted then this scale was accurate to the ounce. I cannot think of any higher praise for a product.
customer_reviews.author: occamsrazor

customer_reviews.title: Handy
customer_reviews.text: This luggage weight came to great use for us. It was calibrated pretty well and was maybe a pound different than the airports scale. It sure saved us the hassle of trying to rearrange our luggage in the airport to make the weight correct without paying overage fees!
customer_reviews.author: Erica

product_meta.title: Tarriss Jetsetter Digital Luggage Scale w/ 110 lb Capacity (Eggshell)
feature_bullets: 100% Satisfaction Guaranteed and backed by our Lifetime Warranty, something most other brands will not do. As seen in the Huffington Post, Johnny Jet, and the Travel Fashion Girl. Makes a great travel gift for the hard to buy for traveler! See SPECIAL OFFERS on this travel scale further below on this page.
Compact lightweight design travels with you without adding significant weight or bulk for your flight or cruise
110 lb / 50 kg capacity with precision accuracy of 0.2 lb / 0.1 kg.
Easy-to-read LCD display that does not require a battery draining backlight to read, durable stainless steel design, auto shutoff, auto-lock display, long life lithium battery included
Never pay unexpected overweight luggage or baggage fees again!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars4,158 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
